meanings.definition: To concentrate too much on a particular thing or aspect.
meanings.sent1: She was overfocusing on her homework, spending hours on just one math problem.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overfocus on his work, sometimes forgetting to take breaks.
meanings.sent3: The detective was overfocusing on the smallest clue, missing the big picture.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was overfocusing on the upcoming test, unable to think about anything else.
meanings.sent5: The artist was overfocusing on every brushstroke, striving for perfection.

meanings.definition: The act of giving too much attention to one specific detail or task.
meanings.sent1: His overfocusing on the project caused him to miss the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The student's overfocusing on grammar made her essay lack creativity.
meanings.sent3: The chef's overfocusing on presentation led to the food getting cold.
meanings.sent4: The manager's overfocusing on one complaint made him overlook the overall satisfaction of customers.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's overfocusing on technique affected her overall performance in the game.
